document.masterDocTitle: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

General distribution. Europe: Albania , Bosnia Herzegovina , Bulgaria , Croatia , Cyprus , FYR Macedonia , Greece (incl. Crete), Montenegro , Romania , Slovenia . West Asia: Jordan , Lebanon , Syria , Turkey (
Zapparoli 2002
; Minelli et al. 2006 ).

Records in Peloponnisos (5, 7, 8, 11) (
Fig. 3
). Ahaia: Aroania Ori (18, 19); Aroania Ori, Kalavrita, Ski Resort ( 19 ); Aroania Ori, near Likouria (14, 19); Chrikali, along Tethros River ( 19 ); Kalavrita gorge (12, 19); pass between Klitoria and Kalivia, 1200 m (15, 19); Lapas (3, 9, 19 ); Patra (3, 9, 19 ). Argolida: Argos (13, 19); Argos, along Inachos river ( 19 ); Larissa, near Argos (2, 4, 6, 10, 19 ); Nafplio (2, 4, 10, 13, 19 ); Tirintha (2, 4, 6, 10, 13, 19). Arkadia: Oros Menalon, Vitina (14, 19); 1 km E Vitina, crossroads to Vitina, 1025 m ( 19 ); Tripoli (1, 3, 9, 19); NW of Tripoli, road to Alonistena, 1450 m ( 19 ). Korinthia: Lake of Stimfalia (15, 19); Oros Killini, 1500 m (14, 19); Oros Killini, Ano Sinikia Trikala, 1500 m (18, 19); Oros Killini, summit, 2350 m (18, 19); Oros Killini, Oros Ziria, 2010 m ( 19 ). Lakonia: near Alepochori, 850 m (14, 19); Taigetos (17, 19); Taigetos, Ladas (loc. typ. of
Lithobius fasciatus
subsp. graeca var. picta
Attems, 1902
) (7, 11, 19 ); Taigetos, Poliana, 1000–1300 m (14, 19); Taigetos, Profitis Ilias (16, 19). Messinia: Kalamata (3, 9, 19 ); Kalamata, between Artemissia and Langada Pass ( 19 ); Ithomi (4, 10, 19 ).

New records from Peloponnisos (
Fig. 3
). 1 ♀, Ilia, Neohori, 40 m ,
N 37.51792
/
E 21.61389
,
20 Apr. 2003
, P. Cerretti;
1 ♂
, 1 ♀, Ahaia, Kalavrita, Mt. Aroania, 1700 m ,
17 May 2004
, G. Osella.

Ecological notes. 0–2600 m ; an euriecious species, common in open
Quercus coccifera
and
Juniperus macrocarpa
scrubs, in broadleaved woods (
Quercus
spp.,
Castanea sativa
,
Populus
sp.), in
Platanus orientalis
riparian woods, in mixed or pure forests with
Abies cephalonica
,
Pinus nigra
,
Fagus sylvatica
, in Mediterranean phrygana, in caves, and in agroecosystems (
Chamberlin 1956
; Zapparoli 1994 , 1996 ,
2002
).

Remarks. The specimens from Peloponnisos are assigned to the subspecies
Eupolybothrus litoralis graecus (
Verhoeff 1899
)
, according to
Eason ( 1970 )
.
